main.name: Ricky Woodruff
main.description: Competitive Programmer - iPhone App Developer - Bukkit Plugin Developer
main.bio: Hello! My name is Ricky Woodruff, and I am a sophomore Computer Science student at the University of Texas at Austin.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: Completed coursework in Artificial Intelligence, Entrepreneurship, and Web Development

work.title: Software Engineering Intern - Pay Product and Growth
Software Engineering Intern - Product Adoption
description: Created an automated email campaign in Ruby that utilizes batch processing technologies to deliver customized fraud insights to users who churn from Stripe Radar
Re-instrumented promotional campaigns in React to allow for standardized analytics tracking
Constructed analytics dashboards using Redshift to track the performance of promotion and email campaigns

work.title: iOS Development Instructor
description: Guided 36 middle school and high school students through the basics of full stack native iOS development by developing 3 iOS applications at Facebook and Stanford University campuses
Utilized resources such as Google’s Firebase to develop the final social media application

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Configured a Raspberry Pi to work as the central operating system of a reconnaissance drone for the U.S. Military and collaborated with other engineers to transmit a low-latency video feed to the Microsoft HoloLens
Enhanced an iOS project in Swift dedicated to improving users’ mental acuity and audited a TSA “pat-down suit” by debugging Intel Edison board data packets with Wireshark

projects.title: Trinity Prep iPhone App
projects.category: Mobile App for Trinity Preparatory School students
